name: disqualification
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ C or U ] the act of stopping someone from taking part in a competition or activity, usually because a rule has been broken, or the state of having this happen to you: disqualification from The fans' bad behaviour has resulted in the disqualification of their team from the championship. The penalty for such an offence is automatic disqualification.
[ C ] something which prevents you from getting a position or taking part in an activity: Inexperience is not necessarily a disqualification for high political office. Perhaps wanting the job should be a disqualification in itself. See
disqualify
More examplesFewer examplesShe faces six months in prison and a disqualification from keeping animals.Disqualification from driving does something to prevent motoring offenders from repeating their crimes. 50 years ago motherhood was widely regarded as almost a disqualification from athletic excellence.
